item.title: Ashes 2025: Nathan Lyon injured as Australia wins series on day five of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval
item.description: Ben Stokes laments the end of England's Ashes "dream" as Australia wins the third Test by 82 runs on a surprisingly tense final day to take an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

item.title: Salt lakes' 'unreal' rainbow of colours captured by photographer in WA's Wheatbelt
item.description: For photographer Scott Jon McCook, seeing the unique salt lakes of WA's Wheatbelt from the air was so captivating it started a five-year passion project.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios handed wildcard into Brisbane International as his tennis return continues
item.description: Former Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios is handed a wildcard to the Brisbane International as he sets sights on an Australian Open return.

item.title: German aerospace engineer Michaela Benthaus becomes the first wheelchair user to go to space
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Paraplegic engineer becomes the first wheelchair user to blast into space
item.description: The flight was just 10 minutes but the capsule still managed to soar 105 kilometres up, skimming into space.

item.title: Destructive storms pass through Melbourne with extreme fire danger in north-west
item.description: Victorians faced intense rainfall, damaging winds and large hailstones after severe storms swept across parts of the state. Emergency services called on road users to drive carefully in dangerous conditions.

item.title: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high
item.description: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

item.title: Agnes Water Museum says it houses a 100-year-old orange in its collection
item.description: Visitors question why the piece of citrus was kept in the first place, but the small town museum credits the region's weather conditions which kept it from rotting.

item.title: PM announces review of intelligence and law enforcement in wake of Bondi attack
item.description: Former top bureaucrat Dennis Richardson is appointed to lead the review, which will report in April of next year.

item.title: After the Bondi attack, the contrast between Chris Minns and Anthony Albanese has been stark
item.description: As Sydneysiders paid their respects to the Bondi terror victims, one moment captured the contrast between two Labor leaders and their perceived responses to antisemitism.

item.title: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, gender-affirming hormones for children
item.description: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

item.title: Nathan Lyon injured on fifth day of Adelaide Test as England hunt a miracle to keep Ashes series alive
item.description: The 38-year-old spinner pulls up lame after diving to save a boundary in the morning session of the fifth day of the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Police investigate alleged daylight assault of woman at Burleigh Heads National Park
item.description: Police are appealing for information after a woman was allegedly assaulted in broad daylight on a popular Gold Coast walking track.

item.title: How a Reddit tip proved vital for uncovering the suspect of the Brown University shooting
item.description: On December 13 a gunman killed two Brown University students and wounded nine others, escaping by foot.

item.title: How staying quiet led Pluribus to be one of the most talked about shows of 2025
item.description: Pluribus, the new show from Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul creator Vince Gilligan, presents a life of perfect harmony — all you have to do is give up your individuality.

item.title: Nathan Lyon's hamstring, Marnus Labuschagne's hands and Jamie Smith's hack — quick hits from day five of third Ashes Test
item.description: Jamie Smith is pilloried as "a dope" after an ugly dismissal as Nathan Lyon is injured and Marnus Labuschagne creates more catching magic. Here are the quick hits from day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Australia defeats words with actions to outclass England and romp to Ashes glory
item.description: In the pre-series furore, with England crowing and injury concerns mounting, Australia stayed quiet. Its response has been an emphatic and quite brilliant Ashes domination.

item.title: 'I will not hide who I am, an Australian and a Jew': Jewish leader Alex Ryvchin
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bondi terror attack hero's father receives standing ovation
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nine killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
item.description: The incident happened just before 1am local time at a licensed tavern in Johannesburg's Bekkersdal township.

item.title: Is 2025 ending with an AI bubble? We could be at a turning point in history
item.description: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

item.title: Here's what defined Australian politics in 2025
item.description: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

item.title: Staff at Melbourne building company say wages went unpaid as employer threw lavish parties
item.description: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

item.title: What we do and don't know about the Bondi gunmen's month in the Philippines
item.description: The long shadow of the Bondi shooting has darkened the coastal southern Philippines, causing deep confusion and stoking long-held anxieties over terrorist groups in the region.

item.title: Calls for gun law reform clash with gun lobby resistance
item.description: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

item.title: Doctors delay surgery for patients on GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic over increased risk of pulmonary aspiration
item.description: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

item.title: Insolvent business run by former AFL star wipes its debt of millions, and the taxpayer is left to foot the bill
item.description: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

item.title: England's Bazballers finally admit they've got things wrong in this Ashes series
item.description: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards at their own failings after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

item.title: US says it is intercepting third Venezuelan oil tanker amid simmering tensions
item.description: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: Long-awaited wine industry mandatory code of conduct too late for growers
item.description: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

item.title: How domestic violence offenders use the court system to inflict more pain
item.description: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

item.title: Given the all clear from cancer, 6yo Laylah celebrates by ringing the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital
item.description: When six-year-old Laylah-Jane Morton rang the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital, it marked the end of her chemotherapy treatment for blood cancer — and she had her merry band of eight siblings with her to help her celebrate.

item.title: Christmas bonuses boost staff morale, but employers facing 'tighter margins' may struggle to give
item.description: From hams to vouchers and cash, festive bonuses vary — but do they still have a place in the Australian workforce?

item.title: Nathan Lyon and Pat Cummins likely out of Boxing Day Ashes Test with series secured
item.description: Nathan Lyon's injury leaves selectors with another headache, made trickier by Pat Cummins's admission that he will almost certainly miss the Boxing Day Test now that the Ashes are won.

item.title: High school students forced to fight false allegations of AI cheating
item.description: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

item.title: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol MCG during Boxing Day Test
item.description: Officers from the Critical Incident Response Team armed with long-arm weapons will patrol outside the MCG during the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

item.title: Man charged with murder after woman's death at Northfield
item.description: A 42-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman was found dead in a home in Adelaide's northern suburbs on Sunday night.

item.title: How your town can become a 'dementia-friendly' community
item.description: The small Victorian town of Ouyen, 440 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, is known for its grain and sheep farms, but also for being "dementia friendly".

item.title: Man arrested for knife possession at Christmas carols event in Launceston
item.description: Police charge a man after he allegedly produced a 30-centimetre knife at a Christmas carols event in Launceston.

item.title: Nikhil Chaudhary hits six out of Kardinia Park in match-winning BBL half-century for Hobart Hurricanes
item.description: Hobart star Nikhil Chaudhary launches a ball onto the roof of Kardinia Park in Geelong, but his 79 off 38 is still not enough to earn him player of the match honours in the win over the Renegades.

item.title: Seasonal workers claim unfair bonus cuts and poor conditions on NSW cherry orchard
item.description: Ten pickers who worked at Hallmark Cherries' orchard in NSW complain about poorly maintained accommodation and failure to pay an end-of-season bonus.

item.title: James Ransone, star of The Wire and It: Chapter Two, dies at age 46
item.description: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

item.title: Calls for urgent intervention to help Victorian teachers find affordable housing
item.description: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

item.title: Jenny Croom thought Portrait Artist of the Year was a scam — then she won it
item.description: Jenny Croom put her art on hold for her family; now the 77-year-old has been crowned Australia's 2025 Portrait Artist of the Year.

item.title: Seven wind turbines provide unique canvas for Indigenous artist Sara Riches
item.description: A renewable energy project being built at one of Western Australia's biggest gold mines has been transformed into a unique canvas for an Indigenous artist and about 200 schoolchildren.

item.title: School children have inspired art works which will be installed on wind turbines in WA's Goldfields.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NSW parliament likely to pass Australia's toughest gun laws, crackdown on protests
item.description: NSW parliament looks likely to pass what would be the strictest gun laws in Australia.

item.title: Zdravko 'Zed' Bilic's legacy to live on through youth sport initiative
item.description: The wife of the beloved soccer coach, who died during a home invasion, wants to help break the cycle of youth crime through sport.

item.title: Former chief justice urges national Bondi terror attack royal commission
item.description: Calls for the federal government to hold a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack continue after NSW announced intentions for a state-level royal commission, prompting some confusion about the difference.

item.title: Seven injured as car crashes into Royal Hotel Capertee, near Lithgow
item.description: A man has been charged after seven people were injured when a car crashed into a pub on the New South Wales central tablelands.

item.title: Government confirms plans for gas reservation on east coast
item.description: Chris Bowen makes a long-anticipated announcement about reserving a portion of gas on the east coast for domestic use after a cabinet meeting.

item.title: Lake George hides an earthquake fault zone, and scientists are using your road noise to see it
item.description: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

item.title: Building a village means showing up even when it feels hard, says Esther Perel
item.description: Building and maintaining a village doesn't just happen. It takes effort. It means showing up even when it feels hard or inconvenient, says psychotherapist Esther Perel.

item.title: Bondi gunmen filmed 'firearms training' and threw explosives into crowd, court told
item.description: The Bondi gunman accused of killing 15 people conducted "firearms training" in a regional area with his father and recorded a video about their "justification" for the attack, according to documents released by a Sydney court.

item.title: Measles cases almost triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue
item.description: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

item.title: Royal commission into Bondi attack appears inevitable for Albanese government
item.description: The prime minister is undoubtedly facing tough conversations behind closed doors, but until the public gets to witness the scrutiny he will never satisfy his critics.

item.title: Tasmanians in 1971 speak about legalising cannabis
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Why Mitchell Starc is open to playing on to the 2027 Ashes series
item.description: Mitchell Starc will be 37 by the time the 2027 Ashes kicks off in 18 months' time, but the in-form quick is open to spearheading Australia's attack in their next clash with England.

item.title: Alleged racial hatred event organiser Ryder Shaw refused bail
item.description: A 20-year-old who allegedly tried to organise a racial hatred event at Cronulla on the same day as the Bondi Beach terrorist attack is refused bail.

item.title: Industry and musicians explore ways to make vinyl records more environmentally friendly
item.description: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

item.title: Anthony Albanese apologises for what Jewish community experienced after Bondi attack
item.description: Anthony Albanese says he is "sorry" for what Jewish Australians have experienced, while announcing a package of legislative changes.

item.title: Stuart Broad still believes Australia's Ashes-winning team is their worst side in 15 years
item.description: Stuart Broad has attracted plenty of criticism for his low opinion of the current Australian team but the England great stands by his harsh assessment.

item.title: Family tells inquest young mother 'died of a broken heart' as system failed to protect her
item.description: The NSW Coroners Court hands down findings into the 2023 death of a young Indigenous mother after a doctor gave evidence the woman may have died from "broken-heart syndrome".

item.title: Should I pour leftover liquids or foods down the sink?
item.description: Ever been about to pour rancid milk down the sink and thought, "Hmm, maybe I shouldn't…"? What about the tomato passata that's gone off? Or the water you washed the paint in? Or that pungent oil from a tuna can?

item.title: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences
item.description: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

item.title: City Beach fined $14m by Federal Court over button battery safety breaches
item.description: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

item.title: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima
item.description: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

item.title: Festive season to bring Christmas Day heatwave to Perth and Cocos Island tropical cyclone
item.description: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

item.title: Man charged after death at Big 4 Port Willunga caravan park in Adelaide's south
item.description: A 49-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the alleged murder of 72-year-old Gary Hallam at the Big 4 Port Willunga Tourist Park at Aldinga in Adelaide's south on Monday.

item.title: Three bushwalkers rescued from Lake Rhona in Tasmania's south-west
item.description: Three "cold and wet but otherwise uninjured" bushwalkers have been airlifted out of Tasmania's remote south-west after calling for help.

item.title: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard as four other Aussies named
item.description: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia set to resume ceasefire negotiations amid deadly border conflict
item.description: Bangkok says the two countries will return to the negotiating table this week amid claims the initial peace deal was rushed for Donald Trump.

item.title: Uber and Lyft partner with Chinese tech giant for self-driving cars in London
item.description: Rideshare companies Uber and Lyft are planning to bring self-driving cars to the streets of London in the first half of 2026.

item.title: Man behind deadly Taiwan metro attack planned it for over a year
item.description: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

item.title: Fire Rescue Victoria sues United Firefighters Union over $1.6m in taxpayer-funded 'service fees'
item.description: Taxpayers have funded $1.6 million in payments to the firefighters union via Fire Rescue Victoria, court documents allege, under an income protection scheme the state's fire chief has said should outrage all Victorians.

item.title: Today in History, December 23: Uruguay legalises recreational cannabis use
item.description: Twelve years ago today, Uruguay became the first country to legalise recreational marijuana use. The experiment is still unfolding.

item.title: Unhinged Christmas movies quiz: Can you pick the real movies from these ridiculous plots?
item.description: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

item.title: Stephen Cubis was the face of GIM Trading when investors lost millions but his story began long before then
item.description: Stephen Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

item.title: Better late than never: The gas fix to a problem that should never have been
item.description: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

item.title: Videos and CCTV give fresh insight into gunmen's plot to target Bondi Beach
item.description: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

item.title: Beekeepers on high alert as bee-killing varroa mite spreads in South Australia
item.description: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

item.title: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks
item.description: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

item.title: A chaotic 'up-crash' as markets and economic realities made for a turbulent 2025
item.description: AI. Market records. Tariffs. Penguins. TACO. It's been a big year of economic shocks and surges as the international framework of global trade was shredded. Here's how key players saw the year that was.

item.title: Liberal-linked Tasmanian public relations firm Font PR shuts
item.description: It has helped keep the Liberals in power in Tasmania and lobbied on behalf of Airbnb, the salmon industry and the Catholic Church — but the PR firm, described as having "fingers in a lot of pies", is closing down.

item.title: Sisters in Sweat — the Sunday football session that grew a sporting movement of over 15,000 Indian women
item.description: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

item.title: Driving Home for Christmas singer Chris Rea dies aged 74
item.description: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

item.title: Thousands of birds are dying on a remote island with no end in sight
item.description: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

item.title: Two men die in separate stabbing incidents in Melbourne on Monday
item.description: A man died after he was stabbed during an altercation in Clyde, in Melbourne's south-east. Just hours later another man was fatally stabbed in Fitzroy.

item.title: Swiss court to hear Pari islanders' climate change case against cement giant Holcim
item.description: Residents of the tiny Indonesian island of Pari, which risks being swallowed by rising seas, win the right to have their climate change case against cement giant Holcim heard in a Swiss court.

item.title: Wild Christmas week ahead for Queensland with days of severe storms forecast as temperatures ease
item.description: The weather bureau is forecasting heavy rainfall and thunderstorms for large parts of the state over the Christmas week, but temperatures are expected to ease.

item.title: The Epstein files divided Trump's base and now more fights are brewing
item.description: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

item.title: Cross-border commissioner's death leaves border towns in limbo
item.description: Towns, like Goondiwindi on the Queensland-New South Wales border, wait to see who will replace the late Ian Leavers in the role of cross-border commissioner and continue his work.

item.title: WA's water regulator is probing South32's impacts on neighbouring farmland
item.description: The owner of a farm neighbouring South32's major bauxite mine in WA claims the miner is responsible for rising salinity and reduced water availability at his property. His claims are now being probed by WA's regulator.

item.title: Poor sleep, unhealthy diets and stress compound to leave homeless at risk of dying decades early
item.description: Western Australian research is showing a strong link between homelessness and poor health, with life expectancy more than 30 years lower for people without secure housing.

item.title: Thunderstorm arrives in Broken Hill ahead of Christmas.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: In a 'complete 180', graziers get early Christmas present with significant rainfall
item.description: The heavy rainfall is welcomed by graziers and follows months of dry conditions in the state's far-west, with hot temperatures and wind battering the land.

item.title: Donald Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland
item.description: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

item.title: Bonnie Deas putting WNBL lessons to use in US college basketball with University of Arkansas
item.description: Bonnie Deas is shining in US college basketball, and she puts a lot of her success down to a WNBL semifinal trial by fire against Australian basketball great Sami Whitcomb.

item.title: Plans to burn red tingle trees temporarily suspended following treetop protest
item.description: The WA government abandons plans to burn a parcel of forest that is home to a species of rare tree after a 70-year-old man spent six nights living in the canopy.

item.title: Residents of The Rock, in southern NSW, take on businesses to keep town alive
item.description: After giving to her community for decades, Barb's town is now working hard so people like her never have to leave for necessities.

item.title: Serie A soccer game between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium called off
item.description: A historic Serie A soccer clash between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium in February is called off, with sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation blamed for making it "impossible".

item.title: Ashes 2025: Pat Cummins, Nathan Lyon out of Boxing Day Test, Jhye Richardson and Todd Murphy in squad
item.description: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

item.title: Man sentenced to home detention after hiring crane to damage Mount Gambier home
item.description: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

item.title: Despite warnings from Donald Trump, the push for Israeli control over the West Bank continues
item.description: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are approved, with some Israelis excited while Palestinians are left fearful.

item.title: Ferrari crash reportedly kills Call of Duty co-founder Vince Zampella in California
item.description: Vince Zampella has died after a crash on a scenic road north of Los Angeles, according to local broadcaster NBC4.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: NSW premier defends protest laws, saying 'words lead to actions'
item.description: Chris Minns says new protest laws will be introduced despite "resistance to the government's legislative agenda in recent days".

item.title: Newmont's Cadia Gold Mine to spend $300,000 on monitors after dust incidents
item.description: One of the country's largest gold mines in the NSW Central West will buy five new dust monitors after incidents at its tailings dam.

item.title: Historic giant sequoia tree in Hobart's St David's Park 'very, very sick' after fires and vandalism
item.description: An 88-year-young giant sequoia tree is "declining rapidly" in St David's Park in central Hobart due to a range of disturbances, including vandalism and fire, the council says.

item.title: Rain-hit orchards still producing 'best quality' lychees in time for Christmas
item.description: After season constraints and rain-delayed harvests, this summer is producing exceptional Queensland lychees, according to the wholesalers.

item.title: Woman appears in court after failing to 'keep the King's Peace' and allegedly biting ACT police officer's leg
item.description: A failure to 'keep the King's Peace' and biting a police officer has almost landed a Canberra woman in jail for Christmas.

item.title: Central West horticulturist supplying Australia's Christmas trees
item.description: From a backyard in Wollongong to a booming farm in the NSW Central West, Christmas trees are big business for Lawrence Ranson.

item.title: Judge accepts guilty pleas from Colorado funeral home owners for abuse of 191 corpses
item.description: Authorities say Colorado funeral home operators Carie and Jon Hallford gave fake ashes to some families of the dead.

item.title: Activist groups flag constitutional challenge to proposed NSW protest restrictions
item.description: Three prominent protest groups flag they will launch a constitutional challenge to NSW Premier Chris Minns's new laws restricting protests in the state.

item.title: Latest 'Battle of the sexes' commodifies and risks mocking historic event
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios' match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

item.title: Anthony Albanese recommends changes to parliamentarians' travel rules
item.description: Under the recommendations, family of parliamentarians would be restricted to economy class flights and an allowance for three annual "Australia-wide" return trips would be scrapped.

item.title: Koala protection in south-east Queensland to be shaped by new strategy
item.description: The Queensland government is inviting the public to have their say on a new strategy to protect the south-east's koala population.

item.title: Gregory John Walker jailed over Arthur Haines' death after 1998 Sydney firebombing
item.description: Gregory John Walker is sentenced to at least six-and-a-half years in prison for unlawfully killing a teenager by firebombing a Sydney home in 1998 during an escalating neighbourhood dispute.

item.title: Best podcasts of 2025, from Forged to Fela Kuti: Fear No Man
item.description: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

item.title: As a newly single mum, I am redefining Christmas with my kids
item.description: This is my first Christmas as a single mum where I will wake up without my son in the home. I won't be watching him excitedly tear into presents. It's not easy, but there's also some relief, writes Catherine.

item.title: No air conditioning in Shellharbour Hospital ward during heatwave
item.description: Patients swelter in an Illawarra hospital ward after an air conditioning unit fails during a heatwave.

item.title: Therapeutic Goods Administration issues warnings over heavy metals in Ayurvedic tablets
item.description: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

item.title: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day
item.description: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

item.title: NSW oyster growers face contrasting holiday seasons as Christmas Eve rush looms
item.description: The Christmas oyster harvest is flourishing on the NSW south coast, but further north it is a very different story as growers face the fallout of this year's record-breaking floods.

item.title: Severe Christmas heatwave scorches WA as Tropical Cyclone Grant strengthens offshore
item.description: Perth, and much of WA, is enduring a severe Christmas heatwave with extreme fire danger, while Tropical Cyclone Grant intensifies offshore.

item.title: ECB managing director Rob Key to investigate England's Noosa break following Ashes failure
item.description: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

item.title: Pat Cummins could miss T20 World Cup to manage back injury
item.description: Pat Cummins could be held back from the upcoming T20 World Cup as Australia look to manage his workload following his recent back injury.

item.title: NSW police officer Jack Hibbert released from hospital after being shot in Bondi terror attack
item.description: A young police officer who was rendered blind in one eye after being shot during the Bondi terror attack is released from hospital.

item.title: Delta Electricity found guilty over 2022 fish kill near its Vales Point Power Station
item.description: A court rules a maintenance failure caused hundreds of fish to die near Delta Electricity's Vales Point coal-fired power station in September 2022, a month after another kill triggered by natural causes.

item.title: Dead fish found at Lake Macquarie in 2022
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Melbourne faces its coldest Christmas weather in two decades — but Victoria's summer heat is on its way
item.description: Temperatures in the Victorian capital are unlikely to climb past 17 degrees on Christmas Day, but the state will swing back to some warm to hot days ahead of the new year.

item.title: Up to 1,700 jobs axed days out from Christmas as security firm MA Services collapses
item.description: A "significant number" of employees have been made immediately redundant as MA Security — which provides security and maintenance services to major retailers like Coles, Kmart and Amazon — enters administration.

item.title: CommBank reverses refusal to refund $68m in excessive fees for low-income earners
item.description: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

item.title: Woman treated for suspected bite after eastern brown snake became trapped in her shoe
item.description: A woman has been rushed to hospital after a brown snake curled around her leg, becoming trapped in her shoe.

item.title: Robert Donald Blackberry jailed after hay bale scam targeting Tasmanian farmers
item.description: A judge blasts a man's "complete and utter disregard for the law" and jails him for scamming farmers desperate for feed out of money for hay bales he never delivered.

item.title: Aboriginal legal aid lawyers launch High Court challenge to NT bail laws
item.description: The North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency says hundreds of people are likely being held on remand in Northern Territory jails "unlawfully and unconstitutionally".

item.title: Former Higgins MP Katie Allen dies of cancer at age 59
item.description: Former federal Liberal MP Katie Allen has died aged 59, after developing a rare form of cancer, her family has announced.

item.title: Nigerians welcome schoolchildren, teachers released after mass abduction
item.description: Nigerians get their first look at 130 children and teachers released after being seized in one of the largest mass abductions in the country's history.

item.title: Anthony Albanese's Christmas message for Australians
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Anthony Albanese and Sussan Ley release Christmas messages in wake of Bondi attack
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Sussan Ley are urging Australians to "stand together" this Christmas in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Sussan Ley's Christmas message for Australians
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Adelaide academic accused of attempting to kill her ex searched methods to kill, court hears
item.description: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

item.title: US approves Wegovy pill, giving Novo Nordisk an edge in obesity drug competition
item.description: A daily weight-loss pill will soon be available in the US, after the regulator gave approval to Danish drug company Novo Nordisk's oral version of the popular injectable, Wegovy.

item.title: NSW parliament passes tougher laws on guns and protests after Bondi Beach attack
item.description: After a marathon debate lasting into the early hours of Christmas Eve, the NSW government has passed controversial law reforms sparked by the Bondi massacre.

item.title: Cooler spring blamed for Tasmania's later Christmas berry, cherry harvest
item.description: Christmas is usually a boom time for Tasmanian berry producers, but this year's cold spring has slowed crops and hurt profits.

item.title: Gun and protest laws tighten after Bondi Beach terrorist attack. Here's what you need to know
item.description: The Minns government has recalled parliament to tighten laws around protests and gun ownership following the shooting at Bondi Beach that killed 15 people.

item.title: Do you know how to make the gravy? Test your Christmas song knowledge
item.description: Which Christmas hits didn't do as well on the charts as you'd think? Test your knowledge of festive cheer.

item.title: Today in history, December 24: A world-first in solar heating
item.description: On December 24, 1948, a family of Hungarian refugees moved into a small house in Dover, Massachusetts. But there was a catch.

item.title: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem after two years as Palestinians hope for 'better future'
item.description: For the first time in two years, Bethlehem has restarted its Christmas festivities to "reignite the spirit that everybody needs" while Palestinians continue to live under restrictions.

item.title: Boxing Day sales set to be biggest on record as interest rate relief drives retail rebound
item.description: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

item.title: Australian businessman Ranjit Thambyrajah languishes in Vietnam jail after string of failed loan deals
item.description: A high-flying Australian financier accused of swindling a struggling Vietnamese petroleum trading company has been languishing in a Ho Chi Minh City cell for two months.

item.title: Epstein files email reveal 'A' at 'Balmoral' sought 'inappropriate friends' from Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: Someone who referred to themselves as "A" at "Balmoral" emailed convicted child sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001, asking if she had found them "some new inappropriate friends", the latest Epstein files document dump has revealed.

item.title: A $7m unpaid tobacco fine and online sales emerge amid government crack down on illegal trade
item.description: Illicit tobacco retailers have racked up millions in unpaid fines since the introduction of stronger penalties, with one owing more than $7 million.

item.title: Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault of two women
item.description: The British comedian now faces seven charges of sexual assault involving six separate women.

item.title: Donald's Buloke Times newspaper gets new owner after 150 years in north-west Victoria
item.description: The Buloke Times, the "heartbeat of the community", has a new owner after being in one family's hands for more than a century.

item.title: Rain on Queensland's Christmas forecast, north-west on flood watch
item.description: It may not be the most welcome weather at the beach, but out in the west, rain is the best Christmas gift.

item.title: When Australia could get 6G after Trump launch of 'race' to next generation of mobile connectivity
item.description: Donald Trump says he wants the United States to lead the world in the "6G race" and has given his government one year to find out how to begin making it happen.

item.title: Pressure builds on Milano Cortina organisers amid climate concerns and funding issues
item.description: The head of the FIS has raised concerns over snow and financial issues affecting the Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games, suggesting that a radical rotation system of hosts should be considered.

item.title: Runner Nancy Dickman, 83, prepares for her next marathon at 90
item.description: Nancy Dickman has run marathons in London, New York, Rome and Sydney, and at 83 shows no signs of slowing down.

item.title: Australian dollar jumps to 14-month high, ASX falls as gold and silver hit record highs — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market is down on Christmas Eve, despite the value of US stocks, gold and silver climbing to their most expensive levels ever, while the Australian dollar has jumped to its highest level since October 2024.

item.title: Samoan weightlifters Seine Stowers and June Sipaia are breaking records and inspiring women
item.description: Last month Samoan weightlifters Seine Stowers and June Sipaia broke World and Oceania records. Their success is due to a generational shift in attitudes to women in the sport, and a world-class facility at home.

item.title: Woman's miraculous Arnhem Land survival story after ankle 'snapped in half'
item.description: Lying on the ground with her ankle snapped in half in the remote bushland of western Arnhem Land, her mind racing, and with no help or phone reception, Margie Moroney began to crawl.

item.title: Mohamed Salah claims Africa Cup of Nations record as Egypt beat Zimbabwe
item.description: Mohamed Salah scored at his fifth Africa Cup of Nations tournament in a row, becoming the first Egyptian player to do so.

item.title: Double-lung transplant recipient Johnnie Tumai's plea for Christmas organ donors
item.description: Johnnie Tumai is preparing to spend his first Christmas at home since receiving a new set of lungs. He's urging others to register as donors this festive season.

item.title: RBA flags potential for interest rate hikes in 2026
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Charities experience a spike in volunteering at Christmas, but they need year-round support
item.description: Across the country, charities that historically have had strong volunteer bases are seeing a decline in numbers. There's one day bucking that trend.

item.title: A US bone marrow donor is reunited with the Perth man she saved.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Father of three meets bone marrow donor who saved his life for 'most special Christmas'
item.description: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

item.title: Tarina Warren has been legally blind since she was 16, now a seeing eye dog is helping her navigate life on Moolooloo Station
item.description: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

item.title: Sabra Lane farewells ABC radio program AM after nine years as host
item.description: Sabra Lane is farewelling the ABC's AM after nine years of hosting the current affairs radio program.

item.title: Regional communities pull together amid cost of living pressures
item.description: The WA Council of Social Services has found single-parent families are falling short of covering the cost of basics by $90 a week, while the shortfall for renting pensioners is $70.

item.title: Convenience over tradition as gen Z and millennials favour pre-peeled prawns over the Christmas period
item.description: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

item.title: Home affairs minister cancels visa of British national charged with displaying Nazi symbols
item.description: The Australian government has promised changes to make it easier to deport people who spread hateful views.

item.title: Two killed in crash between car and motorcycle in Adelaide's south
item.description: The men, both in their 60s, crashed at the intersection of Main South Road and Sunvalley Road in O'Halloran Hill on Tuesday.

item.title: Bondi terror attack heroes to be recognised in new honours list
item.description: The prime minister announces those who showed "extraordinary" bravery during the Bondi terror attack will be recognised in a new honours list.

item.title: WA farming community loses 500 sheep, thousands of hectares of crops in fire
item.description: A bushfire emergency in Warradarge is over, but farmers say the work to recover what was lost has only just begun.

item.title: Brooks Koepka leaves LIV Golf in major blow to breakaway league
item.description: Golf superstar Brooks Koepka has cited family priorities as he announces he is leaving the breakaway LIV Golf league.

item.title: New Madinah College given deadline after principal's comments about Zionism
item.description: A NSW Islamic school could face de-registration if it does not provide evidence its principal is "fit and proper".

item.title: Kate Winslet makes her directorial debut with family Christmas movie Goodbye June
item.description: The actor talks about why she felt compelled to make the Christmas-themed film and why she was lucky to get Helen Mirren to play the titular role.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches Cocos (Keeling) Islands as severe Christmas heatwave scorches WA
item.description: Preparations are underway far off Western Australia's north-west coast for the impact of a category one cyclone as Perth and much of the state continues to swelter in heatwave conditions.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart yacht race not expecting repeat of last year's horrific conditions
item.description: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is in for milder conditions this year than in 2024, when two people died on the first night of racing, although sailors have been warned to expect strong winds.

item.title: 'Fake' letter and 'false claims' among latest Epstein files, US Justice Department says
item.description: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

item.title: Video purported to show Ben Duckett drunk in Noosa
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: England investigates Ben Duckett Noosa video as disastrous Ashes tour takes another turn
item.description: A video said to feature Ben Duckett is under ECB investigation in another problem for England's disastrous Ashes tour.

item.title: Sewage leak prompts Broadwater swimming warning ahead of Christmas
item.description: Swimmers and boaties are being warned to avoid part of the Gold Coast Broadwater at Biggera Waters after a sewage leak, just days out from Christmas.

item.title: '$10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton' stolen in alleged home invasion at Old Beach, Tasmania
item.description: Two armed offenders allegedly forced the occupant of a house north of Hobart to open a safe, escaping with about $10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton items, police say.

item.title: Girl, 12, critical after being pulled from water at Trigg Beach in Perth's north
item.description: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

item.title: Young motorcyclist warns others after surviving high-speed crash
item.description: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

item.title: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail
item.description: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

item.title: WA Police charge man over alleged antisemitic comments on social media
item.description: A WA man's eligibility to hold a gun license will be reviewed after police charged him with allegedly posting antisemitic comments on social media.

item.title: Man in his 30s dies after e-scooter accident in Geraldton
item.description: Police say a man has died after losing control of an e-scooter in Geraldton overnight.

item.title: Woman charged over fatal stabbing of Zac McRae at Western Sydney bus station
item.description: Emergency services were called to a bus station at Mount Druitt in August to find two 19-year-old men with stab wounds.

item.title: Tropical Santa turns to an icy esky to beat Australia's sweltering Christmas heat
item.description: Santa Claus has devised a special ice esky throne to beat the heat in outback Australia this year.

item.title: Man charged after weapons, detonators allegedly found at Dublin property
item.description: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

item.title: Bondi Beach gunmen's phone pinged near Philippine region known for Islamic extremism, police say
item.description: Mobile phone data suggests the Bondi Beach gunmen may have travelled near a region in the Philippines where Islamic State-aligned militants could still be operating, a police source has told the ABC.

item.title: NSW premier is 'not done' with reform in wake of Bondi terror attack.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NSW premier says tougher gun, protest laws bolster safety as reforms take effect after Bondi terror attack
item.description: Premier Chris Minns says some of the tougher laws on guns and protests in the wake of the Bondi Beach attack will go into effect immediately after the NSW Parliament passed a package of changes in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

item.title: Low-income adults and children in jail denied lawyers over Christmas
item.description: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.

item.title: Police investigate alleged attack of Norwegian tourist on Melbourne's St Kilda Pier
item.description: Police are searching for a group of up to eight people allegedly involved in an assault last Thursday, which left a Norwegian tourist with a broken arm and facial injuries.
